<title level="1" right="Trait">[Construct](/Traits.aspx?ID=35)</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 346 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

A construct is an artificial creature empowered by a force other than [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117). Constructs are often [mindless](/Traits.aspx?ID=108); they are immune to bleed damage, [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) attacks, [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), and the [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), and [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) conditions; and they may have Hardness based on the materials used to construct their bodies. Constructs are not living creatures, nor are they [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160). When reduced to 0 Hit Points, a construct creature is destroyed.
